cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic and 70 miles SE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Irma is tracking west-northwest across the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas through Friday, then is forecast to bend northwest and north, moving up the Florida peninsula Sunday and across southern Georgia Monday–Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys / South Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings across the Turks & Caicos, southeastern-central-northwestern Bahamas, northern Dominican Republic and northern Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from South Florida northward through Georgia and South Carolina is within the 5-day cone and exposed to tropical-storm-force wind probabilities
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are probable, with a 63 % chance within the next 5 days and peak chances Monday; low (29 %) chance for 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large wind field and onshore flow could drive a 3–5 ft surge along the Georgia coast, especially around Monday high-tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain from Irma’s northern flank could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, causing flash-flood concern.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend; risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands as the center moves inland Monday.
